base_note.note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY REPORT

Patient: James Wilson
MRN: 2866345
Date of Birth: 11/03/1985
Date of Procedure: 2025-07-15
Location: Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, OH

Attending: Dr. Erin McCarthy, MD
Fellow: Dr. Alex Rivera, MD (PGY-7)
RN: Jennifer Adams
RT: Marcus Thompson

INDICATION: 39-year-old African American male with bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy and scattered bilateral upper lobe perilymphatic nodules on CT chest. Clinical presentation consistent with pulmonary sarcoidosis. Bronchoscopy for tissue diagnosis.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Suspected pulmonary sarcoidosis, Stage II

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same (pending pathology)

PROCEDURE:
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Bronchoalveolar lavage
3. Fluoroscopic-guided transbronchial lung biopsy, right upper lobe

SEDATION: Moderate sedation (Versed 3mg, Fentanyl 75mcg) with topical lidocaine

PROCEDURE NOTE:
Patient was sedated and bronchoscope introduced via oral route. Airway examination revealed normal vocal cords, patent trachea, and normal-appearing carina. All visible airways were free of endobronchial abnormalities. Mucosa appeared normal throughout.

BAL was performed in the right middle lobe using 150mL sterile saline (3 x 50mL). Approximately 75mL of slightly turbid fluid was recovered and sent for cell count, differential, CD4/CD8 ratio, cultures, and cytology.

For transbronchial biopsies, the bronchoscope was advanced into the right upper lobe. Using biplanar fluoroscopy (AP and lateral views), the biopsy forceps (standard cup forceps) were advanced into the RUL anterior segment (RB3) and positioned approximately 2cm from the pleural surface. 8 biopsies were obtained from the right upper lobe, targeting areas of perilymphatic nodularity.

Each specimen was placed in formalin and examined visually - multiple fragments appeared adequate in size. Minimal bleeding occurred, controlled with wedge technique. Repeat fluoroscopy at end of procedure showed no pneumothorax.

FLUOROSCOPY DATA:
- Total fluoro time: 1.8 min
- DAP: 24 mGy·cm²

SPECIMENS:
1. BAL - Cell count/diff, CD4/CD8 ratio, bacterial/fungal/AFB cultures, PCP DFA, cytology
2. TBLB RUL x 8 - Surgical pathology with request for special stains (GMS, AFB)

COMPLICATIONS: None

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: <5mL

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient recovered well. CXR 2 hours post-procedure showed no pneumothorax. Patient discharged home in stable condition.

IMPRESSION: Airways grossly normal. TBLB and BAL obtained for suspected sarcoidosis workup. Await pathology for non-caseating granulomas and BAL lymphocytosis/elevated CD4:CD8 ratio to confirm diagnosis.

FOLLOW-UP: Return to sarcoidosis clinic in 2 weeks for results.

Erin McCarthy, MD
Alex Rivera, MD

evidence.primary_indication: Bilateral hilar LAD, perilymphatic nodules - suspected sarcoidosis

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: Bilateral hilar LAD, perilymphatic nodules RUL

code_rationales.31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy single lobe (RUL) - 8 specimens obtained using conventional fluoroscopic guidance for suspected sarcoidosis.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Standard fluoroscopic TBLB - no navigation system used. This is appropriate coding for conventional TBLB for diffuse parenchymal lung disease workup.

Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Edward Liu
Medical Record Number: 6855565
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: 37 years
Procedure Date: 2024-11-06

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with suspected pulmonary sarcoidosis stage ii. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Transbronchial Biopsy:
Transbronchial lung parenchymal sampling was performed utilizing standard forceps technique with fluoroscopic localization to minimize pneumothorax risk. 
Bal:
Bronchoalveolar lavage was performed in standardized fashion with sequential aliquot instillation and aspiration to optimize cellular yield. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31628, 31624

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
On 2025-06-29, Antonio Martin, a 39-year-old male (MRN 8548428), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Suspected pulmonary sarcoidosis Stage II. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included transbronchial biopsy for tissue sampling, and bronchoalveolar lavage for microbiological and cytological analysis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The visualized airways appeared patent without significant abnormality. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is granulomatous - pending. 

Procedural coding: 31628, 31624.
